page.title: 19Social Concerns
page.content: Inhabitants of the area enjoy living here, although there is a faster turnover of occupancy than in previous years due to the 'new middle class'. These people tend to stay for relatively short periods of time and this has led to diminished interest in village activities. The class structure in the area is clearly defined in political persuasion - there is a vast Conservative majority. Only rarely does one see the whole village 'coming together' as it used to do which is sadly missed by established residents. Young people especially find it hard financially to settle here and tend to move to the towns nearer to their work. Young mothers go out to work whilst their children are still at school to help with the family budget. These factors all help to undermine village life.
